intro: Deutzia × carnea f. stellata, commonly known as the starform deutzia, is a deciduous shrub native to China. It features showy, pinkish-white flowers that bloom in early spring, often in clusters of 5 to 7 petals. The plant has slender, arching branches and small, ovate leaves with serrated edges. It thrives in well-drained soil and partial to full sun, making it suitable for garden landscapes. Its ornamental value comes from its delicate floral display and compact growth habit.
